entry.title: On a new community process to specify covenants
entry.summary: The conversation is about finding a communication channel for a group to develop within the Bitcoin ecosystem. The participants are discussing the pros and cons of various options such as IRC, Slack, Discord, and Matrix. Devrandom suggests using Matrix, which does not require any privacy-invasive information and has end-to-end encryption by default for one-on-one conversations. They also suggest bridging the Matrix room to IRC if there is a significant demand for it. Antoine agrees with Devrandom's recommendation and mentions that people are opting for either Matrix or IRC. They also suggest bookmarking any other ways to encourage or stay open to pseudonymous participation in the process. Ryan Grant thanks the initiator of the group and comments on the importance of having such groups as the Bitcoin community continues to grow. He also mentions the concept of "Tyranny of Structurelessness." Overall, the discussion emphasizes the importance of privacy and pseudonymity while choosing a communication channel for the group's development.
